Player module

class Player.Player(id, name)[source]

Bases: abc.ABC

The abstract base class (inherits from ABC) from which class:Human, class:Computer, and class:Dealer all inherit Each player is initialized with 0 wins and an empty hand represented by [].

Parameters

  • id (Integer) – the id of the integer passed to the player

  • name (String) – the name of the player

Variables

  • id – set equal to id param

  • name – set equal to name param

  • hand – the class:Hand object of the player, instantiated with []

  • wins – integer tracking the number of player wins, instantiated with 0

Returns

Returns a new instance of the Player

Return type

:class`Player`

hit(card)[source]

The hit method defines the logic of adding a card to the hand.

Parameters

card (class:Card) – the card pulled from the deck which will be added to the player’s hand (the ‘hitting’ card)

play_round(Game)[source]

The play_round method organizes the play logic of the game.

Parameters

Game (class:Game) – the current Game instance in which the player is playing. This is important for tracking the deck and hand score.

abstract think()[source]

A required method for all classes that inherit from class:Player that defines their play logic.
